quiz.title: AP Physics 2
quiz.subtitle: Unit 2, Quiz 2: Thermodynamics & Kinetic Theory (Cont.)
quiz.subject: Physics
quiz.topic: Kinetic theory applications, adiabatic processes, PV diagrams, first law of thermodynamics

questions.question: According to the kinetic theory of gases, when the absolute temperature of an ideal gas doubles, the average kinetic energy of the molecules of the gas
questions.explanation: $\langle KE \rangle = \frac{3}{2} k_B T$, so doubling T doubles the average kinetic energy.

questions.question: When gas escapes from a pressurized cylinder, the stream of gas feels cool. This is because
options: Work is being done at the expense of thermal energy.
Of the convection inside the cylinder.
Pressurized cylinders are good thermal insulators.
The moisture in the air condenses and cools.
questions.explanation: The gas expands rapidly doing work against atmospheric pressure, which reduces internal energy and temperature (adiabatic cooling).

questions.question: A thermodynamic system is taken from an initial state X along the path XYZX as shown in the PV-diagram. For the process X→Y, ΔU is greater than zero and
questions.explanation: From first law: ΔU = Q − W > 0 ⇒ Q > W. From PV diagram: X→Y is expansion → W > 0. Thus Q > 0 and Q > W.

questions.question: A thermodynamic system is taken from an initial state X along the path XYZX as shown in the PV-diagram. For the process Y→Z, Q is greater than zero and
questions.explanation: From PV diagram: Y→Z is constant volume → W = 0. Given Q > 0, first law gives ΔU = Q > 0.

scoreMessages.90: Mastery: You understand kinetic theory relationships, adiabatic cooling, and PV diagram analysis.
scoreMessages.70: Solid grasp: Review the direct proportionality between temperature and average molecular kinetic energy, and how to read PV diagrams.
scoreMessages.50: Needs review: Focus on $\langle KE \rangle = \frac{3}{2}k_BT$, first law (ΔU = Q − W), and work calculation from PV diagrams.
scoreMessages.0: Start with basics: Temperature measures average molecular kinetic energy. Gases cool when they expand rapidly without heat exchange. Work = area under PV curve.
